newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa bank to sign Swaziland dam funding deal.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa bank to sign Swaziland dam funding deal.

text.p: The Development Bank of South Africa and the Komati Basin Water Authority will sign agreements on Thursday paving the way for the bank to provide 1.6 billion rand to fund a dam-building project in neighbouring Swaziland.
A memorandum of understanding will see 450 million rand disbursed to the construction of the Maguga Dam itself and 1.1 billion to its associated infrastructure developments.

A further three loan agreements valued at 58.6 million rand will be concluded between the DBSA and the water authority, set up by the two countries to implement the Swaziland project and another dam development in South Africa's Mpumulanga province.
The loans will be used for the construction of access roads to the dam and a proposed housing development there.
The agreements follow a treaty between South Africa and Swaziland entered into in 1992 with regard to the development and utilisation of the water resources of the Komati River Basin.
The memorundum's core principles include minimum resettlement of affected people, integrated environmental management and appropriate communication between the parties involved.
